questions.question: What does ∀x P(x) mean?
options: There exists x such that P(x)
For all x, P(x) is true
For some x, P(x) is true
questions.explanation: Universal quantifier applies to all elements.

questions.question: What does ∃x P(x) mean?
options: For all x, P(x) is true
At least one x satisfies P(x)
questions.explanation: Existential quantifier requires at least one.

questions.question: What is the domain of discourse?
options: The set of all possible values for variables
questions.explanation: Domain is the universe of values.

questions.question: What is the negation of ∀x P(x)?
questions.explanation: Not all becomes there exists not.

questions.question: What is the negation of ∃x P(x)?
questions.explanation: There exists not becomes for all not.

questions.question: What is the scope of a quantifier?
options: The part of formula it applies to
questions.explanation: Scope is the reach of quantifier.
